name: REVOLVER360 RE:ACTOR
description: The world really does revolve around you in this mind-bending shooter where changing your perspective could save your life.
minimum_requirements: OS: WindowsXP/Vista/7/8 Processor: Core2Duo 2.33GHz or faster Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Shader Model 3.0 or later (GeForce 8600 GT/Radeon HD 3650 or better) Intel HD graphics 3000 or better DirectX: Version 9.0 Additional Notes:

reviews.review_text: People who are looking for a Bullet Hell SHMUP with a new gimmick should really try this game]. It's got a great presentation, with great visuals, a decent soundtrack, and a unique revolving mechanic that allows you to place bullets for maximum points or to help you get out of an impossible situation. The live update for where you place on the leader boards really adds to making the player want to better their skills at destroying the most bullets as possible to increase the score multiplier. I really can't believe the game hasn't gotten any buzz.

One of the best shmups I've played in a long while. The central rotation mechanic is really cool and the manuvers you can pull off with it are mindbending. It's tough at first, but when you get that perfect angle to vaporize everything on the screen with your awesome lazor it's satisafying as hell. A must buy if you love shmups.

>> This review might be updated later with some extra info <<  DAAAAAAAMN! THIS GAME IS AWESOME! REVOLVER360 RE:ACTOR is a shoot'em up game; but it has a very interesting difference from other games in this genre: you can rotate the enviroment! For example, you can use this ability to line up several rows of enemies and destroy them at once or to avoid screen filling attacks. This ability also made the game a lot challenging since the enemies and some goodies are placed around the enviroment. In addition to this ability, you have access to a straight laser attack which can eliminate enemies and some projectiles, and an overdrive move which removes every projectile from the screen. There are three modes to play in this game. I recommend completing the challenges before playing through Reactor mode to learn the basics.  Positive Points: - The enviroment rotation mechanic is very innovative and has made the game unique - Multiple paths in stages - Nice difficulty (The game is hard at first. But when you get used to the mechanics it becomes easier.) - Nice visuals and soundtracks (Soundtracks are bundled with the game.)  Negative Points: - TOO MUCH BLUE COLOUR!  Notes: - The game can freeze on launch due to one reason: downloading scoreboards. To avoid this, check ((Offline Mode)) in game's config file which is in the game's main directory. - I haven't finished the game, so it's early to tell the game is short or not. I'll update the review later about this.

Seldom do I feel the need to praise a game for its uniqueness, creativity, or its functionality, even less so all three together. A fast paced game that will never feel the same each run (unless you always die at the start). Its rotating mechanic is its defining part, its graphics are elegant, beautiful and well designed. The landscape (and everything in it) contrast well that I can only describe it as stunning, even the name registration kicked my scifi geek within into gear as I tactifully inputed my desired name (although I might just be easily impressed). The music is well made and only adds to the excitment. I look forward to seeing how they will continue to further this in the future.

Well first of all this is a good game. Its 360 game mechanic is so well developed and its really interesting to play. Its fun for an hour or so but after that....it just gets so repetetive and just outright boring. Theres no story or plot to it. Theres no upgrades to get and basically you are just replaying the same envirements over and over again withour change at all. You dont earn money to buy items, you dont get skins, and there is nothing to get out of this game. Some of you guys may like it, but it just ticked me off at how there was so much potential in this game.....But if you like this kind of game I highly recommend a rental. Go to your closest game shop and rent it for a week or so. overall I would rate it a 6/10.
